title: Designing Advanced Mathematics Courses Based on Reusable Learning Objects (RLOs)

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of undergraduate-level mathematics (calculus, linear algebra)
context.additional_context: A hybrid design combining self-directed e-learning and classroom instruction in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze RLO components (learning sequences, activities, atoms) to explain hierarchical structures among mathematical concepts.
Learners can design differential equation problem-solving processes using reusable digital objects (multimedia content, interactive modules).
Learners can measure self-directed learning outcomes with an achievement rate of 80% or higher by applying an RLO-based assessment system.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
